title: Combat of censorship
creator: Havlin, B Sh;Worenklein, Daniel
summary: "One morning, two of the biggest book printers in Venice discover that they are competing for the contracts of the same Jewish books. The solution to their problem is clear to both of them - to go tell the Pope that their competitor's books are filled with heresy against the Church, with hopes that the competition's books will be burned. Both of them were successful and an order was passed to burn all volumes of the Talmud throughout Italy. With the order set to be fulfilled on Rosh Hashanah, the Jews of Italy are in a race against time to rescind the evil decree and rescue their beloved seforim. In the meantime, soldiers are scouring the country. In Venice. Padua, Mantua and Rome, Jewish homes and shuls are raided and their seforim are gathered to be burned, among them the precious siddur that our hero, little Eliyahu, inherited from his grandfather Will Eliyahu succeed in recovering his siddur before it is condemned to destruction? Will the Jews of Ita!y rescue their beloved seforim? And who is "Sammy Slick," the mysterious Gypsy boy who befriends our heroes? Why is he helping them? What does he really want? All these questions and more will be answered in Batsheva Havlin's exciting new comic-book. Combat of Censorship, a gripping historical adventure, filled with humor, emotion, and excitement. A story of hope that conquers despair, friendship that conquers selfishness and the struggle of the Jewish people to rescue the holy Torah."--back cover.

title: The queen's palace guards : practical strategies for maintaining your self-worth in the face of hurtful behavior (ona'as devarim)
creator: Adahan, Miriam;Genut, Esther
summary: "As we go through life, we all encounter ona'as devarim, the Torah's term for verbal abuse, whether in speech or gestures. While many people dismiss these incidents as 'just words', the truth is that the body reacts to harsh criticism, disapproval, scorn, or mockery as if it had been dealt an actual physical blow. The Queen's Palace Guards gives your children -- whose sense of identity is being shaped mainly by what others think of them -- the skills they need to feel empowered instead of helpless in the face of inevitable negativity or disrespect"--Back cover.

title: Eli-Copter : Japan.
creator: Bar-Lev, Dan;Bar-Lev, Yoel
summary: "The rescue organization Migdal Yeshuos is always on the run. From New York to Honolulu, from the deserts of Africa to the tundra of Antarctica. If a Yid needs help, they'll be there! This time, the organization receives a call for help in the case of a respected Yid, who is both a Kashrus Mashgiach and a scientist. He has disappeared in Japan under murky circumstances. Without hesitation, Eli-Copter and his partner Itzik set out on a daring journey to Japan to locate the missing Mashgiach. They are shocked when the risky mission ends almost before it begins! The missing Klonimus Kukenberg is perfectly safe and sound. Is it possible that the call for help was unfounded? Was it just a joke they played on Migdal Yeshuos and its dedicated staff members? Or maybe..just maybe...there's something sinister lurking beneath the surface. Is there a dangerous plot that they're trying to conceal? This is what Eli and Itzik will reveal in the pages of this dramatic book! Fasten your seatbelts and get ready for an electrifying journey!"--Back cover, volume 1

title: Trapped
creator: Einhorn, P H;Yarhi, G'aki
note: As serialized in Kindlayn.
summary: Three children find themselves trapped in a menacing country. Filled with fear, they wonder if they will ever find their way back to their loving parents. Their grandfather leads them to safety, but he will tell you that he himself is being led. He feels safe and calm in the knowledge that it is Hashem Who is guiding them through their treacherous journey.The children and their grandfather climb over mountains and cross pitch-black valleys. They give up wealth and comfort in their quest for a life of true values. Freedom? Safety? Those are luxuries they can only dream about. Will they succeed in evading their murderous enemies? Will they fulfill their deepest dreams?
subjects: Iran;History;20th century;Jewish religious education;Emigration and immigration;Grandfathers;Haredi and religious literature;Iranian Revolution 1979;Israel;Action and adventure;Graphic novels;Historical fiction;Religious comics

title: Counterfeit shine
creator: Einhorn, P H;Zmora, Avram
note: As serialized in Kindlayn.
summary: "Shimon and Elazar are caught in the throes of conflict. The flames may still be contained for now, but outside forces threaten the foundation. Will the fire continue to rage? Will it travel with them over lands and seas? Or will it finally sink to the bottom of the ocean floor? Blood-thirsty Indians, a ruthless chief, rich men with gold in their eyes and rough miners, all play a role in this dramatic account. From a village in Russia to the coast of California. From the pit of poverty, to the peak of riches. It is a journey that will take you over mountains and seas and around the world. But all that is just the surface. In truth, it is a journey that will mostly reflect the glowing beauty of a Jewish soul." -- back cover.
subjects: Russia;19th century;West United States;Jewish religious education;Haredi and religious literature;United States;Action and adventure;Graphic novels;Historical fiction;History;Religious comics

summary: "World Was II. As the Nazis approach Wolomin, a group of chassidim flee to the forest with their families. They manage to bring only the barest of necessities with them, but Rav Shmelke, their beloved Rav, remembers to take one additional item: his violin. A violin?! The chassidim were surprised, too. But they knew better than to question their beloved Rav. They soon discovered just what a crucial part the violin was to play in their new lives as partisans living in the forest and carrying out missions against the Nazis. Who are Jozef and Shimshon? Whose side are Menashe and Zusha on? What challenges will the courageous partisans face? And where did the Nazis' dogs disappear to on that first night of Chanukah? Find out all this and more in this beautifully illustrated comic book that will leave you spellbound from the very first scene until the thrilling end." -- back cover.

note: Statement of responsibility from cover.;As serialized in Kindlayn.
summary: "Leifenbaum, Poland, 1650. Nestled within a large forest lies a village with a small Jewish community. When the Jews of the village face serious danger, four little children resolve to save the day! The children won't allow anything to stand in their way! Not the priest, not the old ruler, not the gypsies or their circus, not the pack of dangerous wolves that roam the village streets, and not even the fierce giant! Meet nine-year-old Shloimy, eight-year-old Naftali and the seven-year-old twins, Devorah and Tzipporah. Learn valuable lessons from a mysterious hidden tzaddik, and join them on a journey filled with steadfast emunah in Hashem." -- back cover.

title: Samarkand : the underground with a far-reaching impact. adventures of a Jewish boy in Russia
creator: Zaltsman, Hilel;Hershkowitz, M M (Menachem Mendel);Gershon, Yakov
summary: Under the noses of the strict KGB agents, the Samarkand Underground achieves the unbelievable: and underground yeshiva, mitzvos fulfilled b'hiddur, observance of the festivals and special days on the Chassidic calendar, all in a unique atmosphere that remains unparalleled to this day. In all these adventures, the figure of Reb Hillel Avrohom Zaltzman is prominently interwoven throughout all of the Underground's history and upheavals--from the most difficult and fearful moments, to the delightful and fortunate outcome, with Hashem's help. Get a close-up look at the guidance and special relationship he merited to have with the Rebbeim, advice of chassidim and colleagues, one-of-a-kind experiences, and his trademark way of dealing with any problems that arose, with mesiras nefesh and Ahavas Yisroel swelling from the depths of his heart. --Back cover.

title: Straight from Tammy's heart
creator: Raanan, Ahuva;Peleg, Tirtsah;Rappaport, Aviva
summary: "Toddlers are invited to join their own magical journey into the world of emotions. This book was written specially to introduce very young children aged 1 to 3 to the world of emotions. The text describes events and names emotions using familiar words, while the adorable full-color illustrations show appropriate facial expressions. The child learns that cause and effect exist in the world of emotions too, which makes that world more understandable to them. Straight from Tammy's Heart addresses the experience that concerns this age group most: attachment and separation. This is the age when children acquire their basic sense of trust and security through their relationship with their mother. Repeated experiences of closeness to an available and relaxed mother who is attentive to the child's needs develop in the child the feeling that the world is a good place and that the adults in it can be trusted. When a mother leaves her young child, he loses his anchor and can feel insecure. The book allows toddlers to process the experiences of separation from mother and more, to internalize the message that "soon mother will return."" -- back cover.

Design using 60+ stickers and 80+ starter sketches for your endless ideas. 14+ color fashion illustrations for inspiration! 14+ coloring figures for all levels to enjoy. 40+ color tutorial pages with easy to follow instructions. 110+ pages for hours of creativity and fun! How we dress speaks volumes about who we are. Personal style is a language that can be learned - but how ? Enter Adina's Designs - a fun, powerful workbook that unlocks the mysteries of modern modest fashion, by empowering us with the skills to create real illustrations and designs. Using step-by-step tutorials, Adina's Designs inspire creativity and self-expression, without compromising on dignity and self respect. Fashion designers of all ages will love creating with Adina's Design Sketchbook. The younger ones will find hours of fun in coloring the pages and decorating with the stickers. creator: Jakubowicz, M
summary: "Will the Kippelmans ever manage to catch up with the creature On the Loose? Moving day for the Kippelman family is exciting for more than one reason. On that day, they find out that they're the winners of a Chinese auction prize. But never would they have imagined how the prize would turn their lives so completely upside down... Meanwhile, Henny Kippelman is forced to deal with loneliness in a neighborhood that's so different from where she grew up. When a new girl joins her class, she worries that she's about to lose her long-time friends altogether. Henny's siblings are determined to keep their prize a secret from their unhappy sister - but how long can they keep up the charade? Then the unthinkable happens, and the stakes to keep the secret become even higher... Follow the Kippelman gang and their friends on their whacky journey in this action-packed tween novel. Watch as they learn from their mistakes, make tough decisions, and have some harrowing nighttime experiences, all while growing closer as a family and witnessing some incredible nifla'os ha'Borei up close!"--judaicaplace.com.

title: Friends on wheels. 1
creator: Einhorn, P H;Mizrachi, Asher
summary: "Come join us at the fascinating On Wheels parking lot, where the wheels of fun and education are constantly spinning! Get to know a group of charming friends, each of them unique and unforgettable. Our Friends on Wheels are always on the go, and along the way they learn the secrets of good middos and true friendship. What is the definition of a 'good friend'? When is a joke really funny--and when might it hurt someone's feelings? Am I allowed to say this comment to my friend? Why does anyone care if I come late? These questions and many, many more come to life as our Friends on Wheels take you on the trip of a lifetime! Come inside, get to know them up-close, and laugh with them as they drive through life's adventures...together. In the imaginary world On Wheels, you will laugh and smile along with our new friends. Get ready for a journey that will keep you enthralled! A Beep! Beep! We're on the road!

title: Once upon a page : a guide to drawing and illustration
creator: Pollack, Gadi;Cook, Shalom;Gross, Sherie;Tsetlin, Felix
summary: "There are only two types of books on the subject of drawing available in the world of books. The first is intended for a wide audience and is written in a simple, understandable language for all ("draw a circle and two triangles and behold you have a cat"). The problem is that from this type of book, it is not possible to learn professional drawing. The second type, those books written by professionals and devoted to professionals, are serious and quite deep but written in a dry, boring language and are solely of interest to the professional.The book you are now holding is a combination of the two. It includes amongst its pages professional information but nevertheless is aimed at the general public. The public interest can be compared to students embarking on a field trip to a milk dairy, sweet factory or an agricultural farm, although they are not intending to produce at home yogurt and chocolate or to raise cows, what does interest them, is to experience the production process of these products that they encounter on a daily basis"--back cover.

title: Deep in the forest
creator: Rapaport, Rut
summary: On a frigid winter morning in Germany, an infant is placed on the doorstep of a Jewish orphanage. A short note is the only clue to the child's identity. In Israel, a beloved, elderly mother is lost in a hazy world of forgetfulness. Her devoted daughter is suddenly overcome by a desperate need to piece together the fragments of her mother's past before it's too late. Deep in the Amazon rainforest, a hardworking woman devotes her life to saving gorillas from poachers. Yet despite her best efforts, her painful past catches up to her and threatens her many achievements. Spanning over fifty years and three continents, Deep in the Forest is a riveting tale of loss and discovery, and the unbreakable bonds that unite families. This book keep readers enthralled until the surprising conclusion.
subjects: Jewish orphans;Birthmothers;Mothers and daughters;Israel;Adopted children;Amazon River Region;Fiction

summary: "Special tzaddikim and gedolei Torah over the generations up until today have been blessed to use their words in a wondrous way, to inspire, enchant, and enlighten Am Yisrael. These are the great maggidim, whose meshalim--parables, are as interesting as they are meaningful. Famous names such as Rav Shalom Schwadron zt"l, Rav Shabsai Yudelevitz zt"l, or Rav Yaakov Galinsky zt"l, and many others like them. They were all maggidim. This book, the fifth in the series Travels with the Maggidim, presents four wonderful stories with important messages. Each one can strengthen our avodas Hashem by helping us overcome the sneaky ways of the yetzer hara" -- Page [4] of cover.

Try as he might, he sees no way to extricate himself from the storm in which he now struggles to survive. title: Double agent. Part 1
creator: Sapir, Y;Perkal, E
summary: "Four high-ranking people. Dead. In a single hour. Eyal was playing mental ping-pong, exactly as Buki had taught him. He recalled his words like yesterday: 'When something ignites in your mind, sit down and work it out yourself. Write yourself a briefing, exactly as if you'd be submitting it to your superiors.' What would I write now? It took Eyal only seconds to know. When 'John Smith' comes into possession of Eyal Gilboa's top-secret Mossad file, he blackmails Eyal into helping him...on threat of selling the file to the highest bidder. Meanwhile, in a small Cuban village, a mysterious virus is killing the villagers, and their chief will do anything to save his people. Follow Eyal Gilboa from Israel to New York to Cuba in his next thrilling adventure! Warning! Serious suspense ahead!"--Page [4] of cover.

title: Double agent. Part 2
creator: Sapir, Y;Perkal, E
note: Translation: E. Perkal.
summary: "A soldier gave a long whistle, and as Eyal had expected, another ten armed and uniformed soldiers appeared out of nowhere, all wearing matching smiles of victory. Eyal easily identified their commander by his age and the reverence that the young soldiers accorded him. As soon as he saw Eyal, he aimed his rifle and fired. Eyal dove aside just in time to avoid the bullet, which lodged itself in the tree behind him. At that moment, he understood that the goal of these men was not to capture, but to kill. Acting fast, he pulled a syringe from his pouch, and pushed his sleeve above the elbow. 'What are you doing?' the commander screamed. 'Stop!' Eyal ignored him. Before their scandalized eyes, he injected the brownish liquid into his arm before sending the syringe hurtling into the ravine nearby. If a bit of the costly substance remained in the syringe, it was now gone. Turning to the commander--on the assumption that the low-ranking soldiers had no idea why he'd been condemned to death--he said, 'The antidote you're seeking is now in one place, and one place only. Streaming through my blood. My blood is now worth millions. It would be a shame to murder me, no?' When Eyal Gilboa's mission in a foreign country takes a sinister twist, he finds himself completely on his own with no means of recruiting assistance from either the Mossad or CIA. Their hands are tied, and all they can do is watch from afar and pray that Eyal will survive. Because this time, not only his life is on the line, but also the lives of his family and a village filled with hundreds of innocent people."--Amazon.com.

title: Point blank, Part I
creator: Sapir, Y;Perkal, E
summary: "Why didn't you return the car to Abba in the end?" Efrat stared at her father-in-law's car, bewildered. "And where's our car?" "I'm - " Eyal cleared his throat uncomfortably, knowing he had to break the news at some point. "I brought it in." Her gaze was mistrustful. "For what?" "I'm having it bulletproofed," he admitted, reading the changing expressions on his wife's face: Surprise, fear, and then pragmatic acceptance. "I read once that it's illegal to make changes like that to a car. The police can take the car off the road or even confiscate it." Eyal smiled gently, reaching out with his right hand to massage his aching left shoulder. "You read right." "I also read," she added dryly, maintaining her most officious tone, "that such a thing can cost a fortune. To the tune of hundreds of thousands." "Sometimes more," he added mildly, although his eyes twinkled in amusement. "So - " Efrat swallowed visibly. "What's the point? We're hardly millionaires." Her husband's expression changed from amusement to gravity. "To be prepared." "Who's out to hurt you?" Eyal Gilboa is still dealing with the consequences of his last assignment, recovering physically and involved with the capture of the last of the Swearers. But when the GSS needs him, he is forced to choose between his country and his own brother-in-law. This time, he is not always on the same side as his fellow Jew. Both Eyal and Amiel find themselves in Tavor Prison, each one for a completely different reason. Why are they there, and will they remain both loyal to their family and true to their ideals?"--Amazon.com
subjects: Intelligence service;Undercover operations;Jewish families;Action and adventure;Fiction;Spy fiction;Thrillers

title: Ice cubes : a novel
creator: Malovitzsky, Sarah;Djalilmand, Shira Yehudit
note: This novel originally appeared in Hebrew under the title : Kubiot Kerach.
summary: "Batya Adler was a normal tenth grader - giggling during assembly, fighting with her sister, and doing her fair share of complaining. Until that day. After a fainting spell in class and all kinds of tests, the diagnosis was revealed: kidney failure. The shock was total: to Batya, to her family, to her friends and classmates. She would need dialysis at least three times a week, while keeping up with schoolwork, social life, and responsibilities at home. Except she couldn't. Everything that was so important to Batya - to any teenager - was over. It was all she could do to stay awake and on her feet some. When her situation starts to deteriorate, and time is of the essence, Batya is forced to battle - literally - for her life. What will Batya discover about herself - and everyone around her - in her fight to live? The answers surprise everyone, most of all Batya herself. Batya is funny, candid, and so very typical for a teenager, even one who is deathly ill"--Publisher's description.

title: Not easily severed
creator: Luxenberg, Miriam
note: This novel originally appeared in Hamodia under the same title.
summary: "When Rabbi Yeshaya Barkoff passes away, a lot of things happen at once. Wishing to honor his final request, his wife Tzivia and his three grown daughters make their way to Eretz Yisrael for his kevurah, planning to take the next flight back and sit shivah at home. But a huge storm cancels their flights, leaving the bereaved ladies to spend the week of mourning in a rented apartment in Jerusalem. Not even a day passes before the first secret marches into the shivah house, speaking a foreign language and shattering assumptions. Soon after, Tzivia is shocked to learn that she's the proud owner of a beautiful home in the heart of the Bukharan section of Jerusalem - a home she had no idea existed. What of Rav Yedidya? Will he ever marry? And whom? And in the middle of all the exploding secrets, readers of Against the Wind will be reunited with Rafi, the lovable nudnik, who ends up - through every effort of his own - in the thick of it all. Cry, laugh, and gnash your teeth in frustration along with the Barkoffs, as they slowly discover that their beloved, departed patriarch was far wiser than he let on - and that, truly, so many ties are not easily severed."--Amazon.com

title: Though poppies grow in Flanders fields
creator: Ludzker, Hannah
note: "September 1916. Six months after joining the army, eighteen-year-old Jake Shapiro and his friends find themselves in the Somme region of France. It is here that Jake is confronted with the realities of war. It is here that Jake decides that the only way he'll make it through the war is by putting his faith in Hashem. What Jake doesn't know is that his actions on the battlefield will affect so much more, for generations...November, 2018. It's been a century since the Allies defeated Germany and forced them to sign the Armistice. For twenty-eight-year-old Esther, this date is important. Esther has a passion for history--and family history in particular. As she digs deeper into her family's past, it seems no one has the information she desperately seeks. Then a shidduch suggestion from an unlikely source throws her some unexpected answers while raising many more questions" -- Judaicaplace.com.

title: Secret summer : a novel
creator: Millman, M C
note: "Originally serialized in the Jewish Press under the title Bargain summer."--Title page verso
summary: "The summer started out like any other in the Raskin home. But suddenly Mr. Raskin announces a two-month business trip to Israel. And when, late one night, Nosson Raskin accidentally overhears a strange conversation between his parents, fear starts to grip him. Then Mrs. Raskin also has to go away, and she asks an elderly aunt and uncle to stay with the children while she's gone. Things at home get super crazy after that. Aunt Chassi cleans the house into a frenzy as she uses up what the Raskin children are sure are their last pennies on all kinds of cleaning supplies, while Uncle Shmulik breaks more things than he fixes. It's up to the Raskin kids to come up with a plan to save their family by spending a little and saving a lot. What's the real reason their father is going overseas? Is the Raskin family about to say goodbye to the comfortable life they know and love? And above all, how are they going to survive this totally insane summer? Join Nosson, Yehoshua, and Leora on their zany, creative shopping adventures as they attempt to budget, save cash, and keep their aunt from super shining all their CDs ... right up until the unexpected ending."--Page 4 of cover
subjects: Jewish families;Babysitting;Personal finance;Budgets;Social life and customs;Fiction

title: Separate orbits
creator: Mermelstein, Yael
summary: "Baylee Brenner's face doesn't look like everyone else's face--a fact she's been living with all her life, but which takes on much more import when it comes time to find her soul mate. When the first shomer Shabbos shuttle to Planet Myazma is announced, the Brenners see an opportunity for Baylee to find her match through a completely different model of dating. But the issues on Myazma are more than skin deep. The Zygode is up to nefarious things, his Zygoons are mindlessly doing his bidding, and honest citizens are being sent to The Edge, some of them never heard from again. And what Baylee discovers about herself on Myazma is enough to send her spinning into a completely different orbit."--Page 4 of cover
subjects: Extraterrestrial beings;Dating (Social customs);Interplanetary voyages;Action and adventure;Fiction;Science fiction

The boys escape in a lifeboat and are immediately thrown into a whirlpool of turbulent adventures. Their struggle for survival is matched by their determination to maintain their emunah and raise their sagging spirits." -- Publisher's description.

Gili wants stars and Ayelet is praying that she won't win them. Nava is dreaming of life. And Shunamit is silent. Baruch Baron is the king of his daughter Mali's life. Mali is his treasure, the apple of his eye. But when the legend starts to lose track of the truth, Mali gets caught between things that happened and things that shouldn't happen. Predators lurk in the darkness, and a princess is about to be dethroned. The two stories intertwine, joining in moments of pain, sorrow, and friendship, and the escape room holds it all" -- Amazon.com.

summary: "Feiga is sure she's imagining things. It's someone who really resembles him, that's all. 'Esti, who's that dancing with Leiby?' Feiga is shaking. Rav Rosenberg.' She dodges the question. 'Yes, I saw that. But who's next to him? He's holding Leiby's hands now.' What an amazing resemblance, but that has to be all. 'His father.' Esti turns to Feiga. 'His what?!' Dina is shocked. It is him. Feiga tries to process it. 'Since when does he look like that?' Feiga can't stop looking at Leiby and his father. The father of her children -- JudaicaPlace.com.

title: Room for tomorrow
creator: Rapaport, Rut;Ben Shachar, Chaya Sara
note: Sequel to "No room for two."
summary: "Gitty looked up and her eyes met her mother's. It was a conversation that could be pushed off no longer. Rivkah headed toward the table, sat down across from Gitty, and with seeming simplicity, asked, "Gitty, what do you think of having a new father around here?" Devory looked down at her prosthesis and made the effort to smile. "People think I've gotten over it," she said. "But the truth is that it still hurts. A lot. I see myself in the mirror daily, and it's very hard getting used to myself." "I understand you, Devory," Gitty said. "I, too, lost something very, very big in my life." A long moment of silence fell between the friends. A silence of support, calm, and friendship. It was a moment they both knew to cherish. A year after No Room for Two, Gitty faces a new whirlpool in life. There's a new father and stepsister on the scene and difficult-to-navigate relationships. Devory's lifelong dream now seems out of reach, but who gets to decide what she must give up in order to attain it? Avigayil, the Rebbe's granddaughter, gets married and forges new relationships and ties. Yael faces the difficult test of waiting and acceptance for the first time in her life. Room for Tomorrow is a moving book about girls on the cusp of adulthood, pushing onward despite the many obstacles in their path."--Amazon.com

title: Darkest hour
creator: Shor, Rahel;Djalilmand, Shira Yehudit
summary: "I look for a moment through the window facing the front of the hospital. Just a small window on the side of the corridor. The sight shocks me. There are so many cars parked there, and at least a hundred people standing around with huge cameras. My social worker, Galia, takes me gently aside. 'You have to understand, Bruria, yours is an exceptional case. This story has made waves all over the world. Everyone wants to see the woman who woke up after seventeen years in a coma.' Meet Bruria, who wakes to a life she didn't choose, and doesn't have the tools to navigate. Who must meet her family anew and start her life again. Who must come to grips with what she's lost and what she's gained. Who must face her darkest hours if she's ever to see the dawn."--Amazon.com.

Just when the Baker boys realize that a new baby will mean less space, they find out that they'll have to make room for some unexpected houseguests. Three's company, six is definitely a crowd! title: Don't look back
creator: Rosman, Bracha
summary: "When Peri Silver steps into a deserted parking garage one day and inadvertently becomes a witness to a crime scene - and the criminal's next target - her life and that of her family is upended from one moment to the next. From typical frum Brooklyn family to fugitives in the Witness Protection Program, the Silvers are whisked away from everything familiar and forced to relocate and restart their lives, under a new, secret identity. But how can a frum family simply disappear without a trace? As their former neighbors set out to find the Silvers, their new community tries to uncover their suspicious background, too. Will the Silvers succeed in overcoming their fears and maintaining the facade of their assumed identities, or will their past be discovered, exposing them all to terrible danger?"--Page [4] of cover.

summary: A tragic accident forever alters life for Judy Kleiner. Her sister, Frumie, tirelessly dedicates nearly all of her energy and time to Judy, who lies paralyzed and helpless, a constant reminder to Frumie of the painful truth she is desperate to avoid. When Judy gets accepted to a Jewish boarding school, in the remote southern British countryside, Judy is ecstatic. But Judy's happiness comes with a hefty price--Frumie must accompany Judy to the school. Torn by guilt and her natural desire for a life of her own, Frumie must struggle to help her sister while finding a place for herself.

When a hurricane threatens his small town, Shloimy knows just what they all need: a Helping Heroes club - a group of strong, smart, brave and resourceful kids who will help the residents deal with the storm and its results. But his plans seem to hit a snag when Shmuel, Shmaya, and Shaul walk into his room ...The four boys head out on a wild, heart-stopping journey in which they not only save Shloimy's father, but learn valuable lessons about disability, dealing with challenges, and accepting those who are different than us." -- Judaica Place website.

title: Time travelers
creator: Einhorn, P H;Segelowitz, S
summary: "Did you ever read a book ... only to have the main character suddenly pop out and invite you to go back with him to his village? No? Well, the Landau kids did. Efraim's invitation comes just as the Landau kids are contemplating his sad existence - the hunger, the fear, the heartless poritz ... and yet nothing about Efraim's happy smile and cheerful demeanor seems to match their expectations. How is it even possible? With so many painful things to deal with, and no toys or nosh or even enough food - how can he not be sad? Join the Landau family as they travel back in time to Efraim's long-ago village. Cheer them on as they devise a courageous plan to thwart the wicked poritz's plot, and learn along with them what it is that truly makes a Yid happy." -- Judaica Place website.

title: Rebel with a cause : one woman's desperate search for meaning and truth
creator: Djalilmand, Shira Yehudit
summary: "I stood alone on the pavement, suitcase in hand, staring at the closed door of my house. As far I was concerned, my home was gone forever. So begins Shira Yehudit Djalilmand's riveting story of her life, a story which begins in a small, dusty manufacturing town in the West Midlands of England and takes us on a tumultuous journey through her rebellious teenhood to her wanderings in Morocco, across the Spanish countryside, and eventually to a kibbutz in the Negev. Searching desperately for some meaning to her existence, this Christian-born young woman wrestles with the deepest questions of mankind and nearly despairs of finding the answers that would bring peace to her tortured soul. When she finally finds that peace, her questions fall away in the face of the enormity of the gift she'd been given...the gift of Torah and Judaism. Rebel with a Cause, by talented and popular Mishpacha writer Shira Yehudit Djalilmand, is an eye-opening, gut-wrenching memoir, amazing in its honesty and in its author's quest for truth."--Page [4] of cover

They'll have to sneak across hostile borders and avoid informers who could report them to the police. Should they take the chance? This is the true story of two girls who make a courageous decision. title: Unpaid ransom
creator: Lehmann, Marcus 1831-1890;Mindel, Nissan;Kleinman, Zalman
summary: The story of Rabbi Meir of Rothenberg, one of the leading Torah scholars of European Jewry. When the Count of Hohenberg listens to the advice of the apostate Kempe [Kneppe] to extort more taxes out of the Jewish ghetto in Rothenberg, Rabbi Meir left Germany with family and followers. He was captured in the mountains and imprisoned in a fortress near Ensisheim in Alsace. Tradition has it that a large ransom of 23,000 marks silver was raised for him (by the Rosh), but Rabbi Meir refused it, for fear of encouraging the imprisonment of other rabbis. He died in prison after seven years. Fourteen years after his death a ransom was paid for his body so he could be burried in a Jewish cemetary.

title: Golden apples : parables of the Ben Ish Chai
creator: Kahan, Yaakov;Joseph Hayyim ben Elijah al-Hakam approximately 1834-1909
contents: Introduction -- How Many Birds Were Left? -- Repaying Good for Evil -- The Deceiver -- The Rescuing Robbers -- Mordechai's Dream -- A Painful Punishment -- A Gift from the King -- Three Evil Wives -- True Blows -- The Animals' Reply -- Sewing Clothes for the Moon -- A Nasty Business -- Six Redeeming Words -- The Foolish Wife -- The Tragic Drowning -- The Fate of Swindlers -- What Is Courtesy? -- The Foolish Servant -- A Tale of Two Thieves -- Prosecutor or Counsel for the Defense -- Dead Man at the Party -- The Greater Loan -- The Instructive tour -- The Overturned Ladder -- So-called Friendship -- Wit Versus Weapons -- THe Wise Lad and the Witless One: A Happy Union -- Yochai's Delusion -- Chaim's Purim -- The Wary General -- The Reward of Compassion -- The 'Sin' of the Customs Officers -- Does It Fit? -- The Miser's Donation -- Wisdom or Wealth? -- The Reward for Gratitude -- The Boastful Donkey -- The Battle of Warriors.
summary: "Rabbi Yosef Chaim of Baghdad, universally known as the Ben ish Chai, was perhaps the greatest Sephardic Torah figure of the last few centuries. Scholars found his greatness between the covers of his many works; the masses of Baghdad flocked by the thousands to hear his sermons every Sabbath afternoon. Men, women, and children of all ages and backgrounds sat, stood, and pushed together enraptured, as he spun his web of law, homiletics, and parable, captivating all his listeners, each at his own level. He was as great a storyteller and author of parables as he was a scholar. In the tradition of such Torah giants as the Maggid of Dubno and the Chofetz Chaim, he had an uncanny knack for composing stories that were entertaining in themselves, but also taught eternal lessons. The children were amused and enthralled; the adults had food for a week's constructive thought. In this marvelously versatile book, Yaakov Kahn collects some of the finest parables of the Ben Ish Chai. Aptly, he calls it Golden Apples, following the wisdom of Solomon, who describes the truth within a parable as a golden apple, wreathed by the silver setting of the story that teaches it. Indeed, these stories are pure gold. For parents and teachers, adults and children, speakers and readers, this is a book that will amuse, interest, and instruct. It's the kind of book you will pick up over and over again. No wonder the original Hebrew edition is so popular--and so will this new translation be. This is the first time the eloquence and imagination of the Ben Ish Chai has been brought to English readers. It is long overdue--and sure to be very welcome"-- Back cover.

summary: As a young girl, Tuky lived a carefree life in Budapest, and she and her brothers, sisters, and cousins spent their days learning, playing, and helping others. But life changed drastically when Hungary entered World War II on the German side. With the Nazis in charge, Tuky's family had to separate and go into hiding, and she had to go live with a non-Jewish farm family in the country, along with her younger brother and cousin. Will Tuky be able to remember that she is Jewish, and take care of the little boys? And when will her parents come to take them home?

title: Hidden
creator: Yudasin, Rivkah;Yarhi, G'aki
summary: When Reb Yitzchak Zilber was a young man, he lived in Communist Russia. The government made strict laws against teaching Torah and observing Shabbos. They punished people who wouldn't spy on others and report them for breaking the rules. Because Reb Yitzchak would not tell on a fellow Jew, the government sent him to a work camp that was like a jail. In the freezing cold, far away from his family, Reb Yitzchak had to stack logs in the forest every day. Could he find a way to keep from working on Shabbos?

title: Lightning bolts : and other stories
creator: Jakubowicz, M
summary: What if your parents told you that you were moving halfway around the world, away from all your friends, and everything you know and love? What if the friend you've known all your life suddenly treats you as if you're different, and not in a good way? What would you do if the Queen of England was due to arrive at your camp and you were clueless how to behave in front of her? What if you're invited to join some classmates on the trip of a lifetime but you know, deep down, that something is very wrong? Life is full of lightning bolt moments things that aren't typical, and aren't really supposed to occur ... and yet they do anyway. M. Jakubowicz's Lightning Bolts and Other Stories is all about these kinds of moments. Meet all types of kids just like you and join them as they experience their own unique strokes of lightning.
subjects: Jewish girls;Jewish day schools;Jewish way of life;Fiction;Short stories

title: U turn
creator: Ben Shachar, Chaya Sara
summary: "When Margaret and Julie Miller plummet down the ravine in a horrible car accident, their lives are irrevocably changed. While Margaret is recovering at the hospital, she meets Shiffy Levine and the two form an instant friendship. Meanwhile, big sister Julie is dealing with her guilt at causing the accident. Henry Miller, Margaret and Julie's younger brother, should be celebrating his bar mitzvah and getting ready to join the ranks of Jewish adulthood. Instead he joins a dangerous club and ends up in a lot of hot water. How does Shiffy's father react to the crime committed in his shul? And how do Julie and Margaret go about getting ready for their younger brother's bar mitzvah while making changes in their own lives? U-Turn, a novel about true change."--Amazon.com

title: Over the gate
creator: Rosman, Bracha
note: Novels.
summary: "Layla Schulman has only a long, lonely summer to look forward to in the isolated vacation home her parents have rented high up in the mountains. But in the mysterious woods behind the house, the effects of a tragic secret are about to erupt - with Layla caught in the middle. Rebecca Waldman could lose everything if she sets foot outside her home before she marries. When she finds herself trapped in a scheme that threatens to upend her world - and with the only person who can help her deliriously ill - Rebecca is forced to search deep within herself. In a remarkable chain of events that can only be defined as hashgachah pratis, Layla and Rebecca desperately race against time to unravel the mystery that holds Rebecca hostage. Over the Gate is the gripping story of two teenagers from the turn of the century who discover the power of friendship and selflessness and the strength and courage it gives them. Together, they witness the triumph of good as old secrets are finally laid to rest"-- Back cover.
subjects: Jewish girls;Haredi and religious literature;Fiction;Religious fiction

title: Finish line : short stories about kids overcoming obstacles
creator: Jakubowicz, M
summary: "What should you do when... There's a snake in the house where you're babysitting? Your bike is stolen hours before a grand bike-a-thon? The new kid in your class won't stop playing pranks? The best note-taker in your class can no longer take notes? You're so short that people treat you like a little kid? In this captivating collection of short stories by M. Jakubowicz, you'll read all about kids just like you. Get ready to laugh and cry with them all the way to the finish line!"--back cover.
subjects: Adjustment (Psychology);United States;Haredi and religious literature;Fiction;Religious fiction

title: Uncle Dave's dive machine
creator: Ben Shachar, Chaya Sara
summary: ""There's no choice. If the gyroscope has been off then I'm afraid the ballast system might be under too much pressure. We'll have to surface and dock at the nearest island." Ominous words - particularly when spoken from deep under the ocean in a mini submarine, and with communication to the outside world nonexistent. Yanky, Meni and Eli Bloomenkrantz are off for a short cruise with their Great-Uncle Dave one summer day when they suddenly find themselves stranded on a desert island somewhere in the middle of the ocean. To their surprise, the island is actually inhabited - but an aura of mystery shrouds the island. Who exactly are the islanders and what secret lies behind their peculiar customs? Who is the strange, fearsome Plain Tom who stalks the island and threatens everyone in his path? And why is someone intent on making sure that there is no contact with the outside world? Join the Bloomenkrantz boys as they discover the inner strength and fortitude necessary to navigate the challenges of surviving on a desert island. Uncle Dave's Dive Machine will take you on an exciting, fascinating journey of survival and fortitude, of facing challenges with bitachon and ultimately persevering."--Back cover

title: Power plays
creator: Klein, Yonah
summary: "Dr. Avraham Meltzer was a pioneering chemist on the verge of a powerful breakthrough when he left for a three-day business conference. He was never seen again. His son Reuven, a 12-year-old genius, struggles to come to terms with his father's disappearance. Stepping into Dr. Meltzer's shoes, Reuven races to uncover a formula that will unlock a whole new field of virtually unlimited energy, as well as saving his sick cousin's life. But the same people responsible for his father's disappearance now set their sights on Reuven as well... in a desperate race of power plays."--Amazon.com.
subjects: Gifted children;Missing persons;Orthodox Judaism;United States;Discoveries in science;Jewish families;Detective and mystery;Fiction;Haredi and religious literature

Fun for all ages!"--Amazon.com.

title: Total miss understanding
creator: Millman, M C

Because anything is possible when six new girls who are a total mismatch get thrown into the eighth-grade class at Boker Ohr Academy and make it their mission to be anything but misfits. It's a year filled with a mishmash of missteps, misadventures, misdirection and misgivings. From the mischievous - to the miserable, each girl takes part in one misadventure after another. Make no mistake! You don't want to miss out!"--Publisher's description.

title: Storm chasers
creator: Jakubowicz, M
summary: "There was something fascinating about watching the storm unleash its fury, a wild, uncontrolled force wreaking havoc on the world they knew. After a terrifying night spent huddled on the top floor of their flooded house, the Friedowitz children emerge to find a world turned upside down. Where will they live now that their home has been destroyed? How will they go to school in their storm-ravaged town? And what will happen to Moshe's long-awaited bar mitzvah plans? When the Friedowitzes find themselves housed in the most unlikely of places, a series of frightening incidents threatens their temporary home -- and throws the lives of many people into turmoil. Storm Chasers is an unforgettable and uplifting story that will keep you enthralled as the Friedowitzes bravely confront the challenges of the unknown, persevering with lots of love, laughter and faith in Hashem."--Amazon.com.

creator: Klein, Yonah;Yarhi, G'aki

Entire communities wereuprooted by raging armies of peasants andwarriors, often without warning or sense.During these turbulent times, a smallcommunity of Yidden seeks a home foritself, far from persecution and danger.With nothing but their wits and a strongdose of siyata diShmaya to protect them,the group contends with bandits, crusaders,wild wolves, and more as they search for aplace of peace; a place where Jews can liveand serve Hashem without fear - a placeof Sanctuary." -- Judaica Plaza website.

title: The money sham
creator: Aikhler, E (Ester);Weinberg, Deena
summary: "When Eliyahu Reicher first posted his siyum invitation on the class bulletin board, he had no idea that this would launch him into a long, winding, turbulent journey that would completely upend and change anything he ever knew. Two million dollars disappear into thin air; a class turns its back on a previous favorite; a mysterious shady character refuses to pick up calls; an old, dusty book with an ancient treasure; and a hurricane that rips through cities and blossoming hopes ...In this tale of suspense and intrigue, Eliyahu and his family learn about integrity and loyalty - and the only thing that brings true, lasting happiness." -- Judaica Place website.
subjects: Ultra-Orthodox Jews;Jewish ethics;Jewish families;Translations;Action and adventure;Graphic novels

title: Eli & Sruly and the flashes in the dark
creator: Irenstein, Hadas;Heler, Moti;Ben Shachar, Chaya Sara
summary: "The mastermind behind the major terrorist attacks in Argentina strikes again. An evil plot threatens the Jewish community in South Africa. Eli, Sruly and Roby the Robot find themselves thrust into a hair-raising adventure that takes them through the jungle and into the sea on the other side of the world. Blinding lights, roaring forest animals, a tiny boat rocking on the waves, and a mysterious signaling flashlight... Who is Rabbi Ben David? Will the children manage to save the Jewish community in time? It's a battle of minds, and time's running out!"--judaicaplace.com.

title: The Tehran children
creator: Stahl, Leah;Frankel, Devorah
summary: "In the aftermath of World War II, a group of brave Jewish children embarks on a remarkable journey. As part of a special rescue mission called the Kindertransport, they are brought to a displaced persons camp in Tehran, on the way to Eretz Yisrael. There, the secular camp leaders try to force them away from Torah and mitzvos, but they refuse to give up. With courage and prayer, they stand up for their beliefs and fight to preserve their cherished tradition. Join these courageous young heroes as they navigate a world filled with uncertainty. Discover the power of faith, friendship, and resilience as they fight to keep their Torah values alive. Experience their inspiring story of hope, as they show that even in the darkest times, the light of emunah can guide us toward a brighter future. This captivating tale will take you back to an important crossroads of Jewish history, when the strength of Jewish children shaped the destiny of our nation" -- Amazon.com.
subjects: Jewish children in the Holocaust;Holocaust, Jewish (1939-1945);Iran;Tehran (Iran);Jewish refugees;Poland;Historical fiction;Graphic novels

title: Dark tapestry
creator: Pearlman, Ruthie
summary: "At 7:00 a.m. it was a beautiful London morning. At 7:50 a.m. the nightmare began. Eight-year-old Josh, Don and Ilana Hardman's only child, was gone. In this chilling thriller of kidnapping and revenge, Jewish traditions are lost and refound. The author weaves a tapestry of unforgettable characters: We meet Colin, a hard-bitten London cop who has carefully eradicated all traces of his past as an Orthodox Jew; Leora, a forthright criminologist and baalas teshuvah; and Ilana, a fragile yet indomitable mother. And lurking in the shadows, the terrifying figure of a man crazed by memories forgotten by all but him." -- Publisher's description.

Reuven wishes everything could stay the same, but there are a lot of changes in his life right now. His best friend, David, has moved away, and Reuven needs to get used to his new fourth-grade teacher. But the most upsetting change is the arrival of a new boy, Yehuda Taprik. Reuven hopes Yehuda will be a replacement for David, and that they'll discover they're related. But events don't go according to his plans. It will take Zaidy's fascinating story about the two-way gift to help Reuven understand his confusing feelings" -- Amazon.com.

It starts with his teacher staring at him, during class. Then the principal peeks through the window and stares at him, too. Is Jelly Eli in some kind of trouble? But why? title: E is for Elisa
creator: Hurwitz, Johanna;Malone, Heather
summary: "Elisa Michaels is not a crybaby. Her brother Russell says she is, but she isn't really. Can she help it if tears suddenly just pop out of her eyes? Elisa is a regular girl who loves going to Sunshine Nursery School and is only a teensy bit scared of flashbulbs. Can she help it if adventures have a way of finding her? Whether she's putting the finishing touches on the neighborhood snowman or jumping off a chest of drawers, life with Elisa is full of surprises"--front flap.

title: Elisa in the middle
creator: Hurwitz, Johanna;Malone, Heather
summary: "Elisa Michaels is just trying to help... Elisa has a new house, she's starting a new year in school, and she has a new baby brother. She's in the middle of her family now, and, just like in a sandwich, Elisa knows the middle is best. Elisa wants to help her older brother, Russell, catch up on his homework and give his fish a bubble bath. Why is everyone upset with her? She was just trying to help! At least she can help her baby brother, Marshall. That is, if she's willing to give him the most precious gift of all"--front flap.

title: Make room for Elisa
creator: Hurwitz, Johanna;Malone, Heather
summary: "Elisa Michaels's life is about to change... Elisa is sure she won't embarrass her big brother Russell at his violin recital. She'll sit quietly and listen to the music. She won't sing along while he plays. And she'll keep her mouth closed the whole time. But will Elisa be able to keep her promise? Whether it's moving without really moving, getting glasses for the first time, or getting locked in a room, Elisa's life is always on the move"--front flap.

title: Ever-clever Elisa
creator: Hurwitz, Johanna;Malone, Heather
summary: "Elisa is in first grade, a grade with a number, not like nursery school and kindergarten. She wants to give her new teacher a special present. She even has a great idea. What could possibly go wrong? Whether it's giving away a special ring, surprising her mother with breakfast in bed, losing a lost tooth, or buying a raffle ticket for a cruise to Alaska, Elisa's life is always an entertaining give-and-take."--Dust jacket.

title: Jewish life in America during the Great Depression

summary: "What was life like during the Great Depression? The 1930s were a difficult time for everyone. The stock market crashed, banks closed, and many people lost their money, their jobs, and their homes. In this engrossing book, children will learn about the daily life of Jewish families during this time-- the homes they lived in, the foods they ate, the schools they went to, the work they did, and the games they played." -- back cover.

Elderly Mrs. Golding would love the company - so what could possibly go wrong? In Trouble Ahead, sequel to The New Girl, the Achdus Club discovers that every friendship has its ups and downs. Join the class of 4B as they struggle to stick together no matter what trouble lies ahead.--Back cover.
subjects: Jewish girls;Friendship;Judaism;Schools;Haredi and religious literature;Fiction;Religious fiction

title: Dancing in our hearts : serve Hashem with joy
creator: Fletcher, Michoel;Silverstone, Chaya
summary: "In Dancing in Our Hearts, Rabbi Michoel Fletcher helps us find happiness as we live our lives as Jews. By taking us on a journey through the year and examining our tefillos through fresh eyes, he allows us to experience the joy in our relationship with Hashem and our performance of mitzvos. This simchah, he explains, is contagious. By feeling happier ourselves, we will make our homes, our communities, and the entire Jewish nation full of simchah as well. It's just a small leap and a jump ... and soon we'll be dancing in our hearts, even as we continue our day-to-day routines"--Back cover.

title: The inside story
creator: Lazewnik, Libby;Zakon, Miriam Stark
summary: "News flash! Cousin Yanky from Baltimore is coming to stay with the Bakers--for a very special reason. But his cousins have hardly welcomed him into their home when there's fresh excitement in the family. Family Fortunes magazine has decided to do a feature story on the quints! A reporter and photographer are driving up from New York to spend a whole Sunday at the Baker mansion. What could be more fun? In their brothers' opinion, lots. Moishy, Chezky, and Donny were not consulted, and they're mad. All week long, as their sisters make elaborate plans to impress the magazine people, the boys are immersed in dark counterplots of their own. And Mr. and Mrs. Baker are none too pleased either by the quints' frantic grab for personal glory ... Will Yanky's dreams come true? Will the Baker kids learn to pull together as a team again? It'll take a series of mishaps to bring them all to their senses and to the--what else?--happy ending. Read all about it. We've got The Inside Story"--Back cover

Yael babysits undercover and discovers a horrifying secret. But before she can solve the case, the Simons and their children have vanished and Yael is on the run. Will she find the babies-and the key to their disappearance-before it's too late?

title: Rabbi Avraham Blumenthal : father of orphans
creator: Lieber, Chaya Baila
note: Includes over 30 original photos and documents.
summary: "During World War I, so many children in Jerusalem were orphaned that a new home had to be created for them. Rabbi Avraham Y. Blumenthal created that home. It was called the Zion Orphanage. Rabbi Blumenthal became the children's father. He cared for them day and night. He saved them from starvation and taught them to be good Jews. This is his story. It is the story of a man who became a father to hundreds"--back cover.

title: The Montefiores : champions of the Jewish people

subjects: Jewish philanthropists;Great Britain;Jerusalem (Israel);Biography;Montefiore, Moses, Sir, 1784-1885;Montefiore, Judith Cohen, Lady

title: Yossi of Nigeria
creator: Verzov, Ella;Oirechman, Chana;Mermelstein, Yael
summary: "Hi, my name is Yossi and I'm six years old. I live in Abuja, the capital of Nigeria, on the African continent. I like picking bananas at the plantation near my house and I'm used to playing games by candlelight during our many power outages. I especially love giving out challahs to our friends in honor of Shabbos. Today is the first day of school and I'm starting first grade! I'm hoping to meet new friends and I'm looking forward to learning from teachers who came to Nigeria just for us!"--Page 4 of cover

title: Hanna's harvest
creator: Meyer, Henye
note: A historical novel for teens.
summary: "If only Hanna Farber was good at something! Her pinafores are dirty, her needlework is sloppy, and she's a nuisance in the kitchen. When the Farber family moves from the cramped, stuffy slums of Red Bank to their new spacious home on Caernarvon Street, Hanna hopes things will change. But the city's living conditions are getting worse than ever. The cotton mills are closing and the poor, starving people of Northwest England need serious help--fast! What can Hanna possibly do to assist them? Hanna's Harvest is a colorful, heartwarming tale of discovery and determination by Henye Meyer, the popular author of Starlight. In this historical masterpiece, Mrs. Meyer faithfully recreates Jewish life in Victorian England--from its busy cobblestone streets to the magnificent Great Synagogue. Readers will cheer Hanna on as she strives to become the heroine she'd always dreamed of being"--back cover.
subjects: Jewish girls;Conduct of life;Haredi and religious literature

title: Welcome back Madame Chamberlaine
creator: Wolner, Tzipie
summary: "Hopelessly lost in the mountains? Caught in a Chanukah party blackout? On an eerie overnight in the woods? Mais oui, mes amies... Madame Chamberlaine has arrived! When Madame Chamberlaine-with her tinkling laugh, pink tasseled scarves, and delicious homemade pastries-visits sisters Shprintzi and Shuly, even a simple day becomes extraordinary. Follow along as they visit a fancy French resort, make an emergency landing in a flying car, milk a farm full of cows, and more. Talented author Tzipie Wolner has crafted a collection of exciting and hilarious adventures that are sure to entertain. Fans of her series in Mishpacha Junior as well as new readers will love both the classic and never-before-published tales in this long-awaited sequel to Meet Madame Chamberlaine. So let's begin - on commence!"--back cover.

And who are the two strangers lurking outside? Join Michal and Adda on a mysterious mission, filled with incredible twists and turns, leading to a very close call."--Adapted from back cover.

note: First published 1992.
summary: "It's Chani Kaufman's first month on the job, and she's scared! As if being editor-in-chief of the B.Y. Times weren't hard enough, Chani faces a whole new crop of problems. Nechama and her new assistant, Ilana Silver, are as different as night and day--no wonder they can't seem to get along. Pinky's no help, as her moods swing wildly, along with her family's fortunes. And Raizy, Chani's trusted assistant editor, feels overwhelmed by the combination of newspaper and high school. In fact, the B.Y. Times seems to be on the verge of disintegrating... It takes a false accusation, a false alarm, and a whole new attitude to turn things around for Chani and the paper. Join our old/new staff as they begin a school year brimming with great fun and exciting new challenges."--Back cover.

title: Regards from abroad
creator: Herbst, Devorah
summary: "Seminary. The magic word with the power to instill nervous anticipation among seniors everywhere. I, of course, was no exception. Seventeen-year-old Avigayil Pinter has the perfect life--she is super popular, gets top grades, and has a warm, loving family. For her long-awaited seminary year, her dream is to study in Yerushalayim and be close to the Kosel. Then Avigayil receives the shock of her life. Will she be able to gain the confidence and determination she needs to cope with her new challenge?" -- Publisher's description.
subjects: Jewish women;Jewish religious education;Life change events;Jewish girls;United States;Bildungsromans;Fiction;Haredi and religious literature

title: The little black box : A Shraga Morgenstern
creator: Lazewnik, Libby;Schreiber, Perel

summary: When Shraga Morgenstern and Pinny Katz prepare to accompany their physicist fathers to the Lake View Hotel, they never dream of the perils that lie in wait. Their quiet retreat soon turns into a nightmare when they discover that the new and deadly weapon their fathers have been working on has been stolen. Just when Shraga, Pinny, and their young detective friends think they've solved the mystery, another layer unfolds. Can the boys clear the cloud of suspicion that hangs over their fathers' heads--and survive the sinister "accidents" that threaten their own lives?
subjects: Physicists;Jewish way of life;Detective and mystery;Fiction;Thrillers

title: Passport to Russia
creator: Gross, Sukey
note: First published 1988.
summary: Get ready for a passport to adventure! On her very first day of ninth grade, Bracha meets Sara, a mischievous classmate who quickly draws her into her exploits. The two girls jump right into the mystery of the local candy store owners. What secret lies behind their sad and angry faces? Bracha and Sara are thrilled to be invited on the adventure of a lifetime...a visit to the USSR, where they'll meet Jews trapped behind the Iron Curtain. The plot thickens as they try to help two conflicted Russian teens discover their true identity while warding off interfering KGB spies. Meet Bracha, Sara, and their friends in Sukey Gross's lively, page-turning book, the first in the Rivkah Gross Academy series, now back in print!-- Back cover.

creator: Melekh, Bat ;Goldfarb, B.
summary: "In this fascinating book, your child will join Elazar on his trip to the land of Right Now, a land where you can buy patience in a store... and will return with the wonder formula for patience--a gift for life." -- Publisher's website.

title: Elchanan and Ruthi meet Surprise Land
creator: Rivlin, Sarah;Ariel, Esther;Weinberg, Deena
summary: "Surprise Land is a special placebrimming with surprises. It's filled with gifts that you can take like toys and games and prizes. But you can go in only once and there are rules that you must keep. You can take anything you want --'till you hear the timer beep! Join Elchanan and Ruthi as they follow Miri, the girl who didn't take advantage of her special time in Surprise Land -- and Gayil who did. Follow them as they learn a unique lesson: Our time in this world is best spent grabbing as many mitzvos as we can!" -- Publisher's website.
subjects: Commandments (Judaism);Conduct of life;Haredi and religious literature;Translations;Fiction

title: Never alone : based on a true story
creator: Kraitman, Miryam;Kohen, Avigayil
summary: "Luis is sent to a boarding school for children, far from his home and family. There he finds insulting, derisive comments spray-painted on the building. Somebody is plotting against him. Anti-Semitic donors come to the dormitory. And fighter planes are flying overhead. Why is the school closing? Who stole the valuable piccolo? How did Luis manage to board the ship without a guardian? And where is he sailing to? Join Luis on his travels, and discover how every step of the way comes together to form a magnificent story of Hashgacha Pratis. Because Luis is never alone! Based on a true story!***Never Alone will lead you on a journey filled with laughter and tears, hope and longing, courage and faith. A suspense-filled story, with important lessons about dealing with social and emotional challenges and turning life's trials into spiritual growth." -- Publisher's website.

title: Please be polite
creator: Garber, Susie;Zimmer, Glenn
summary: "What if some kangaroos happen to call and come with their scooters, jump ropes, and balls and trample the garden by jumping so hard and flatten the grass all over the yard? Read about the camels, bears, monkeys, and giraffes who forget their manners...and you'll discover a thing or two about being polite. An entertaining story with hilarious illustrations."--Back cover.

title: The scheme team
creator: Horowitz, Shayna R
summary: "What will Levi think of next? A Diet Coke-Mento explosion? An automatic spoon-feeding birthday cake? A stroller pulled by magnets? No idea is too zany for Levi the Great and his sidekick, Chaim'ke the Pretty Good. When they put their Great Brain and Handy Hands to it, this dynamic duo can make any situation exciting... and a lot whacky! Join the scheme team as they plan daring contests, overcome bullies, win over a grouchy neighbor, and discover the greatest idea of them all - caring about others." -- back cover.

title: Truth or dare : a teen novel
creator: Singer, Chavi
summary: "How dare they? Outgoing fourteen-year-old Raizy Roth had it all: two amazing BFFs and a carefree social life. But when the Roths move to the big city of Greenstone, the good times come to an abrupt end. Super-snob Chani Fischer criticizes Raizy and spreads rumors about her. Raizy feels helpless to fight back and sinks deeply into feelings of hopelessness and despair. Will she ever fit in? When a terrifying incident shakes up the community, the girls' dynamics are disrupted and their lives are irrevocably changed. Truth or Dare, by debut author Chavi Singer, is a powerful story about the games people play to avoid facing the truth and the potential to change the rules. Join Raizy as she struggles to overcome her pain and find her place to belong -- but only if you dare." -- Publisher's website.

title: Who wears a yarmulke?
creator: Lieber, Chaya Baila;Simon, Mira
summary: "Who Wears a Yarmulke? Join Yudi as he searches for just the right spot to put his yarmulke." -- Publisher's website.

title: Layla's Vistaville spring
creator: Holt, Faygie
summary: "Dear Diary, I can't believe it! I'm back in VISTAVILLE!! In the same four-poster bed I slept in last summer. But why am I the only one in my family with a sense of adventure? I just wish there was someone I could share my excitement with. Layla is thrilled to be spending Pesach with Bubby Ida and all her cousins. The anticipation builds when she decides that the Alter Zaidy would be the perfect nominee for Vistaville's Hero of Today or Yesteryear. But Great-Aunt Rivka quickly nixes the idea and won't even say why. When Layla discovers a picture of the Alter Zaidy hanging in the Vistaville library, she tries to use her detective skills to solve the mystery of Crest Mountain and its strange disappearance from the Vistaville map. Popular author Faygie Holt is sure to delight readers with this third installment of the Layla series. Join Layla and her cousins on an adventurous vacation in Vistaville where the mysteries never end, and the intrigue never stops"--Publisher's description.

creator: Fuchs, Menuchah;Hass, Estie

title: Mussia of Morocco
creator: Verzov, Ella;Oirechman, Chana;Mermelstein, Yael
summary: "My name is Mussia and I'm six years young. I live in the city of Casablanca in Morocco. Morocco is a Muslim country with a rich Jewish past. Our city, Casablanca, is a blend of the old and the new: On our street I see peddlers slowly pushing wagons full of merchandise side by side wiht fast-moving cars. Elderly women wearing traditional Djellabas, walk next to businessmen wearing fancy suits. Today we'll join my father on a journey to Marrakesh; we'll tour the mellah - the old Jewish quarter; we'll buy spices at the market in honor of; and we'll ride camels at the foot of the Atlas mountains. Journey along with Mussia through a fascinating day of her life in Casablanca. Watch the role she happily fulfills as a busy young outreach worker "--Back cover.

creator: Wolner, Tzipie

title: Rivka of Thailand
creator: Verzov, Ella;Oirechman, Chana;Mermelstein, Yael
summary: "Hi! My name's Rivka, though my two-year-old sister calls me Icka. I'm eight years old. I was born in Bangkok, the capital city of Thailand. Thailand is a beautiful tropical country that millions of tourists come to visit every year. I love visiting the floating market, drinking coconut milk straight from the fruit, and visiting the nearby elephant farm. Our neighborhood is so crowded and busy that we have to leave our neighborhood with a tuk-tuk in order to find space to play jump rope. What's a tuk-tuk? Well, I guess you'll have to read inside to see! â€¢ â€¢ â€¢ Rivka of Thailand is the fourth book in the Lamplighters series. These books allow young readers to peek into the lives of boys and girls from all around the globe. They meet children who, together with their parents, are trying to help Jews learn more about their heritage. Via these first-person accounts, readers can visit the most fascinating places. They will be drawn into these children's lives and they will learn all about the cities in which they live. Fascinating facts and interesting descriptions alongside authentic professional photographs are included throughout the book"--back cover.

title: Trapped!
creator: Lazewnik, Libby;Zakon, Miriam Stark;Zitter, Emmy
summary: "It's an ordinary Friday afternoon in Bloomfield...or is it? In their hilltop mansion, the Baker girls are all set to spend their first Shabbos on their own. On the other side of town, the staff of the B.Y. Times is holding its usual erev Shabbos meeting in the pizza shop. And above them all, conditions are ripening for a storm like none Bloomfield has ever seen. Just before Shabbos, the thirteen girls find themselves stranded alone in the mansion, completely cut off from the world - trapped by a raging tornado! What lies ahead of them is a Shabbos they'll never forget"--back cover.

title: Layla's Sugarland winter
creator: Holt, Faygie
summary: "Layla is thrilled to be spending winter break with Bubby Ida and all the cousins she met during her summer vacation in Vistaville. But when another guest accuses Layla's favorite cousin of stealing her raffle ticket, emotions heat up and tempers flare. Treasure hunts, mysterious packages, surprise visitors, and cryptic clues make Layla determined to uncover Sugarland's secrets. This delightful sequel to Layla's Vistaville Summer by popular author Faygie Holt is sure to engross its readers. Join Layla and her cousins on a fascinating adventure in Sugarland where the excitement never ends and the discoveries never stop." -- Back cover.

title: On the move
creator: Holt, Faygie
summary: Ruthie Somerfield's family must leave their large, spacious house and move into a small, cramped apartment. Her new bedroom is tiny, she has to ride the crowded, noisy school bus, and she misses her familiar neighbors. And if anyone finds out about it, she'll be so embarrassed! Will Ruthie ever be happy again? Meanwhile, Purim is coming, and that means one thing: dressing up! Shulamis Green wants her costume to match her twin sister, Tova, but Tova has other ideas. Will Shulamis understand, or will she feel that Tova's letting her down? On the Move is the fifth book in award-winning author Faygie Holt's super-popular Achdus Club series. Join these spirited fourth graders as they deal with their problems and move onward and upward, with friendship and achdus.--Back cover.
subjects: Jewish girls;Friendship;Judaism;Purim;Moving household;Haredi and religious literature;Fiction;Religious fiction

title: The summer everything changed : a novel
creator: Roteman, Ellen
summary: "It's great to be positive. But there's real danger in pretending, when you know in your heart that everything is not okay. Yael Kaplan can't wait to babysit the lively Friedman kids -- how else will she afford to pay for seminary in Israel next year? With her super-fun games and original activities, straight from her homemade babysitter's handbook, the summer will be a huge success. But Yael makes a dark discovery that puts her grand plans on hold. Should she keep her concerns to herself, or share them? Ellen Roteman, best-selling author of Production!, tells a compelling story about indecision and growth. Join Yael as she struggles for clarity during a summer when nothing stays the same." -- Publisher's website.
subjects: Young adult fiction;Jewish girls;United States;Jewish teenagers;Babysitting;Secrets;Fiction

title: The flying popcorn tip-off
creator: Milstein, Leah
summary: "Who will win? Faigy. A scavenger hunt with amazing prizes! Plane tickets to anywhere in the United States. Me, on an airplane. Think of where I could go! Alaska! California! Texas! I'll send in the most creative photos. I've got to win that prize. Feivel. Popcorn flying in the kitchen! I'm going to win for sure. The only bad part is that I'm not allowed to use the microwave until I'm bar mitzvah, but it was totally worth it. Faigy said I have to write, "Don't try this at home," but where else would you have a microwave? On the moon? Leah Milstein has done it again! Join the Fisher kids on more wacky escapades as they enter contests, perform dubious science experiments, and discover which state in the U.S. makes the most popcorn." -- Publisher's website.

creator: Wolner, Tzipie
summary: "Madame Chamberlaine is always in season! Runaway bird invading the classroom? Got only half a haircut at the hairdresser? Lost in a massive corn maze? D'accord, mes chÃ©ries...Madame Chamberlaine -- with her pink-tasseled scarves, tinkly laugh, and mouthwatering homemade desserts -- joins sisters Shprintzi and Shuly on one hilarious adventure after another. Follow along as they drive a blaring fire truck on a rescue mission, fly into the sky on a giant trampoline, investigate a creepy crime in snowy Montreal, and more. Once again, popular author Tzipie Wolner has crafted a collection of upbeat, action-packed escapades that are sure to brighten your day. Four Seasons with Madame Chamberlaine is the fourth book in the wildly popular Madame Chamberlaine series -- magnifique!" -- Publisher's website.

title: The Golden Gate

summary: "California, here we come! On their way home from school one day, Bracha and Sara realize that they're being followed. Of course, the irrepressible duo loves mysteries, but this one leaves them perplexed. Why would someone be trailing them through the streets of quiet Pineville? The intrigue heats up after Bracha and Sara are offered tickets to San Francisco to attend a family bar mitzvah. Is their mystery stalker going to follow them all the way to California? Join Bracha, Sara, and Cousin Shoshi as they tour the hills and sites of San Francisco, encounter Chinese gangs, and learn some intriguing family history in this captivating adventure, the third in the Rivkah Gross Academy series, now back in print!" -- Publisher's website.

title: Lockdown : a novel
creator: Pearlman, Ruthie
note: Sequel to: Pearlman Ruthie School of secrets;Sequel: Pearlman Ruthie Disappeared
summary: "MP Simon Dean and his wife, Antonia, are visiting Ner Miriam Seminary, whose staff and students are eager to honor and impress the famous couple. But due to a shocking turn of events, the unassuming school on the rocky crags of England's south coast becomes a crime scene. There's no going in or out - it's on lockdown. Meanwhile, fearless supersleuth Yael Reed is on a mission for closure and clarity as she bravely sets out to meet her biological mother. Will she be welcomed with open arms, or regret her decision to revisit that chapter of her troubled past? In Lockdown, talented author Ruthie Pearlman reacquaints readers with the unforgettable cast of characters first introduced in the wildly popular School of Secrets. This long-awaited sequel will keep you so locked into the thrill of the read that you won't want it to end."-- Page 4 of cover
